name: Burford Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dont let the fact that this hotel is situated on the dual carriage way put you off! It is an excellent hotel with superb service - a welcome change!
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The menu is extensive and delicious and the host's and staff are very attentive. The bedrooms are all different and well equipped with nice pieces of antique furniture.
reviews.title: Contented in the Cotswolds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Burford high street is just round the corner to the right and has lots of lovely shops to wander round.
reviews.title: Fantastic place

likes.disliked: — could hear the traffic at night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got engaged at the Burford Lodge in Feb 2007 and we decided to celebrate our engagement a year on by going back to stay at the hotel again.
reviews.title: OK hotel but unhelpful owners

reviews.text: Unfortunately, I'd come down with a chest infection so wasn't at all well, so we tried to change our booking, however, the hotel were very inflexible with no apologies given. Therefore, we didn't want to throw away £130 so we went to the hotel and I just spent the time in bed! We were just dissapointed that the owners showed no flexibility to us re-arranging our booking - we planned to be regular visitors but now we have left with a bitter taste in our mouths.
reviews.title: Warm, Comfortable and Great Food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went down for breakfast and only my partner ate as I was still ill. My partner had a breakfast with a £3 supplement, and they had the cheek to add this onto the bill even though only 1 of us ate breakfast (and our rate was for 2 breakfasts)! Just seems unnecessary!
reviews.title: A great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Burford is a lovely place and we will definitely be visiting next year but will not be staying at the Burford Lodge
reviews.title: Simply brilliant staff !!

likes.liked: — Clean, good quality freebe soaps etc

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Finding the Burford Lodge after a slow, white knuckled drive from the airport in dense fog, in the dark, was like finding an oasis.
reviews.title: the best yet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Myself and my boyfriend decided a weekend in the Cotswolds was what we needed and chose the Burford Lodge as our base. It’s located just outside the town where all the shops, pubs and restaurants are. Following a 10-15 minute walk, crossing a very busy road and up a fairly steep hill.
reviews.title: A great weekend stay

reviews.text: It was my birthday weekend, and my boyfriend as a surprise lay on champagne and flowers as a birthday treat for our room. Once checked in, there was a knock on the door and I was presented with both.
reviews.title: If carlsberg had a hotel!

likes.liked: — The most amazing bed in the Winters Tale room!!!
likes.disliked: — How can you complain about a perfect stay?

reviews.text: The hotel is based on a rather busy and noisy road, as people have aforementioned. However our room the Reynolds Suite was tucked away at the back (as requested at the time of booking) and we were unaffected by noise. Our room was quite small, yet tastefully decorated and in keeping with the rest of the hotel decor. I have one small niggle about our room, the bed was quite uncomfortable, a tad lumpy in fact, but this didn't impinge our stay. The bathroom was again small, but modern and very clean, with fluffy large bath towels. The bath robes were a nice touch too.
reviews.title: Disappointing Anniversary Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel staff was faultless, incredibly polite and treated us with much respect and grace. We initially only pre-booked dinner for the Friday night, but the menu was packed with an array of choice and the cuisine absolutely lovely we decided to eat on the Saturday night as well. On the Saturday morning we enjoyed a cooked breakfast with fellow guests in the restaurant. On Sunday morning prior to check out, we decided a Continental breakfast in bed was what we needed, this wasn't a problem for the staff and it was delivered promptly.
reviews.title: Top Cotswolds hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check out was efficient, after a small mix up with what we were charged was easily resolved and we left Burford Lodge overall satisfied and certainly would not hesitate in staying there again. Maybe next time however, we'll opt for the 4 poster room.
reviews.title: Lovely stay, quite noisy though

description: Under new ownership since Spring 2012, this honey-coloured Cotswold Stone Lodge has eight individual en suite bedrooms. Our warm and welcoming small team of enthusiastic and caring local staff offer a friendly and charming atmosphere. In an area of outstanding natural beauty, the picture postcard town of Burford has a wealth of antique shops, cafes, bars, National Trust properties and delightful gardens. We serve light lunches and afternoon teas daily between 12:00 - 16:30. Our bar is open until 19:00. We hope your stay with us will be comfortable and memorable and we look forward to meeting you.
